page.title: 05INTERVIEW cont:
page.content:
In 1960 the wages for a farm worker were three shillings a week (15 pence in todays money).The farm labourer today earns approximately 100 pound a week. The farm consists of 595 acres only twelve of which is grass. The soil types are chalk,silt and sand mainly in the valleys. Farming in 1985 is now very technical and also very modernised. One farm labourer can look after 120 acres. A farmer's job requires dedication, and to be able to know what you are doing quickly and efficiently."
After talking to the farm labourer we have decided that his job is hard and requires much determination. Most workers are very loyal and have gained much job satisfaction.
